At Title 6 we enter upon the discussion ol the last department oi Private Law-the ius quod ad actiones pertinet. The division of law into law ol Persons and law ol Things is perhaps as old as Cicero (Invent i. 24), and apparently was the basis ol aclassification in the Perpetual Edict (Dig. i. 5. 2); but Gaius, so far as we know, was the first jurist who added the third division oi actiones. lt may be doubted whether his own conception ol this branch ol his system was as clear as a more modern writer might have made it.
